snippet: Three men and one woman were taken into custody at a Lower Manhattan apartment building with more than 350 bags of heroin, a law enforcement official said.
abstract: Initial tests performed on substance found in packages in Philip Seymour Hoffman’s apartment in Manhattan confirm it to be heroin, though no trace was found of powerful additive fentanyl linked to 22 fatal overdoses; tests give further support to notion, pursued by detectives from the start of the death investigation, that Hoffman had overdosed.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS

lead_paragraph: Three men and one woman were taken into custody at a Lower Manhattan apartment building with more than 350 bags of heroin, a law enforcement official said.

headline.main: Four People Arrested as Part of Inquiry Into Hoffman’s Death
headline.print_headline: Test of Substance in Actor’s Home Finds Heroin, Without Additive
